heisig_chinese_memo: The police track a tiger thief after a long chase down the road and demand that he hand over the tiger. When he refuses they drag him out at gun point.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Your younger brother chases you all the way down the street trying to get you to hand over his toy car.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "辵", "虒" sound, the original meaning is alternation. "Said Wen": "Easier. Congrui, Yisheng." "Songs of the Chu-Nine Debates": "Handed over at four o'clock and died young, and yin and yang cannot be reconciled." Zhu Xi's notes: "Pass, easier."

" Delivery " can indicate order. "Book of the Week‧ Biography of a Foreign Land‧ Lian": "From Jiangzuo and Zhongzhou, there is Bashu, which is too dangerous."

" Delivery " can also mean sending. Tang Dumu's "A Fanggong Fu": "Qin Fuai people from the six kingdoms will be the king after passing the third life to the eternal life."

" Delivery " can also mean escort. "Song History-Hong Hao Biography": "Lengshan is the only swordsman who can stop him, kneel for him."

" Pass " also means podiatry. "Guan Zi: Entering the Kingdom": "Every country has palms to nourish diseases, deaf-blind, dumb, lame, withered, hand-handled, those who are intolerant of self-reliance, the disease of being adopted by the government, the government is the food and clothing, and the body is behind. "Stop." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Pass, hold. It is said that the hands are arched and do not apply." Guo Moruo and other schools: "The hand is sick in the hand; the foot is in the hand, which is a sign of hand and foot contracture.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "辵", "虒", the original meaning is alternation.
humanum_full_description:
從「辵」，「虒」聲，本義為交替。《說文》：「更易也。从辵，虒聲。」 《楚辭‧九辯》：「四時遞來而卒歲兮，陰陽不可儷偕。」朱熹集注：「遞，更易也。」

　　「遞」可表示依次。《周書‧異域傳上‧獠》：「自江左及中州遞有巴蜀，多恃險不賓。」

　　「遞」也可表示傳送。唐杜牧〈阿房宮賦〉：「秦復愛六國之人，則遞三世可至萬世而為君。」

　　「遞」還可表示押送。《宋史‧洪皓傳》：「目止劍士，為之跪請，得流遞冷山。」

　　「遞」亦表示足病。《管子‧入國》：「凡國都皆有掌養疾，聾盲、喑啞、跛躄、偏枯、握遞，不耐自生者，上收而養之疾，官而衣食之，殊身而後止。」尹知章注：「遞，著也。謂兩手相拱著而不申者。」郭沫若等集校：「握者手病；遞者足病，即手足拘攣之證。」
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
遞 (Simplified: 递)
Pinyin: dì
English Definition: to hand over; to pass on sth; to gradually increase or decrease; progressively
Antonyms: 接
Total strokes: 14; Radical: 辵
Pictophonetic: 虒 indicates the sound; 辶 (walk) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿺ Surround from lower left
    • 辶 [ chuò ] to walk; walking
    • 虒 [ sī ] an amphibious beast resembling a tiger with one horn; place name
Example Words:
遞交 [ dì jiāo ]: to present; to give; to hand over; to hand in; to lay before
遞增 [ dì zēng ]: to increase by degrees; in increasing order; incremental; progressive
More: 遞* | *遞 | *遞*

"Book of the Week‧ Biography of a Foreign Land‧ Lian": "From Jiangzuo and Zhongzhou, there is Bashu, which is too dangerous." " Delivery" can also mean sending. "Stop." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Pass, hold. It is said that the hands are arched and do not apply." 遞字的基本解释

遞
dì
见“递”。

遞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dì］
［《廣韻》徒禮切，上薺，定。］
［《廣韻》特計切，去霽，定。］
“递1”的繁体字。亦作“逓1”。
(1)交替；轮流。
(2)顺次；依次。
(3)传送；传递。
(4)押送。
(5)驿站。
(6)驿车，驿马。
(7)蜷曲。谓手足拘挛之症。
(8)量词。表示动作依次经过的段落。
[②]［shì］
［《集韻》時制切，去祭，禪。］
(1)通“適”。适宜。
(2)通“逝”。往；去。
[③]［dài］
［《古今韻會舉要》當葢切，去泰］
围绕。

遞字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【辵字部】　遞； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1263第10
【廣韻】徒禮切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】待禮切，?音悌。【說文】更易也。【廣韻】遞，代也。【正韻】更迭也。【爾雅·釋詁】遞，迭也。【註】更迭，閒厠相代之義也。【前漢·郊祀歌】四興遞代八風生。　又【正韻】迢遞，遠也。　又【增韻】傳遞，驛遞也。　又遞鐘，琴名。【前漢·王褒傳】伯牙操遞鐘。　又【廣韻】特計切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】大計切，?音第。義同。　又當蓋切，音帶。繞也。【前漢·王莽傳】絳侯依諸將之遞，據相扶之勢。【註】言諸將同心，圍繞扶翼也。　又叶徒結切，音迭。【王儉褚淵碑銘】德猷靡嗣，儀型長遞。怊悵餘?，鏘洋遺烈。【註】長遞，猶言長往不返。亦迢遞之意。　【集韻】或作递。俗作逓。

考證：〔【前漢·王莽傳】絳侯依諸將之遞，據相扶之勢。【註】言諸將同心，圍繞附翼也。〕　謹照原文附改扶。

小篆楷体

暂无。
